dialogueLines: The rain started softly that evening — cold but peaceful.
You handed me your jacket, even though you were shivering yourself.
We shared that tiny black umbrella and kept walking close together.
The air smelled like wet earth and freshly baked bread from the nearby bakery.
I hummed that song from my favorite band while the raindrops fell.
The sky was dark gray, with just a hint of orange light at the edge.
We passed by the little bakery, and I said the smell was perfect for the rain.
Our shoes got soaked, and you laughed when I stepped in a puddle.
I said the puddles sparkle like tiny mirrors — you just smiled.
You said the rain feels peaceful, and I agreed.
We stopped at the bridge for a moment, watching the street lights reflect on water.
You said my smile looked warm, even in the cold.
When the rain stopped, I whispered, ‘It’s beautiful now.’
The air smelled clean, and everything was quiet except for our footsteps.
I told you I’d never forget that walk — the sound of rain, your jacket, everything.
The soft piano from the nearby shop played faintly in the background.
I looked at you, drenched and happy, and said this moment feels timeless.
The world felt slow, like even time didn’t want to move on.
I said, ‘Don’t forget this walk,’ and you nodded.
We walked home quietly, carrying the sound of the rain in our hearts.

questions.questionText: What color was the umbrella we shared?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! That tiny black umbrella that barely fit both of us.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t red. It was black.

questions.questionText: What did you give me during the rain?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! You gave me your jacket — it smelled like coffee and rain.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t your scarf, it was your jacket.

questions.questionText: What did I say about the rain?
questions.correctResponse: Right! I said it’s peaceful — remember?
questions.wrongResponse: No… I never said I hated it.

questions.questionText: What did I hum while walking?
choices: A song from my favorite band
questions.correctResponse: Yes! That song from my favorite band — I still hum it sometimes.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t random. It was my favorite band’s song.

questions.questionText: What color was the sky?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! Dark gray with a touch of orange on the horizon.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t blue. It was dark gray.

questions.questionText: Where did we stop for a moment?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! On the bridge — watching the water shimmer.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not the park. It was the bridge.

questions.questionText: What place did we pass by?
questions.correctResponse: Right! The bakery — the smell of bread mixed with the rain.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not the park. It was the bakery.

questions.questionText: What did I say about puddles?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! I said puddles sparkle like tiny mirrors.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I never complained about them.

questions.questionText: What happened to our shoes?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! They were soaked, and we laughed about it.
questions.wrongResponse: No… they were soaked, remember?

questions.questionText: What did I say about your smile?
questions.correctResponse: Right! I said your smile was warm — even in the cold.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not shy, warm.

questions.questionText: What sound filled the evening?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! Only rain — soft, rhythmic, endless.
questions.wrongResponse: No… no cars or voices, just rain.

questions.questionText: What did I say when the rain stopped?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! I said it’s beautiful now — the calm after rain.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I said it’s beautiful now.

questions.questionText: What did the air smell like?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! Wet earth — my favorite scent after rain.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not flowers. It smelled like earth.

questions.questionText: What did I promise to remember?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! I said I’d never forget this walk.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I promised to remember the walk, not the bakery.

questions.questionText: What music played faintly nearby?
questions.correctResponse: Right! That soft piano from the shop nearby.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not pop. It was piano.

questions.questionText: What did I call the moment?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! I said this moment feels timeless.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I didn’t say peaceful, I said timeless.

questions.questionText: What did you say about the rain?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! You said it feels peaceful too.
questions.wrongResponse: No… you never complained.

questions.questionText: What emotion did I show most during the walk?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! Calm — I felt at peace with you.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I wasn’t angry. I was calm.

questions.questionText: What did I ask you at the end?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly! I said don’t forget this walk.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I didn’t say call me, I said don’t forget.

questions.questionText: What did the moment feel like to me?
questions.correctResponse: Yes… timeless — that’s what love feels like, doesn’t it?
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t quick. It felt timeless.
